channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: U.S. figure skater Alysa Liu said she didn't care if she medaled. She won gold
item.description: Liu is the first American woman to win an individual figure skating gold medal since Sarah Hughes in 2002.
item.content:encoded:
Liu is the first American woman to win an individual figure skating gold medal since Sarah Hughes in 2002.

(Image credit: Jamie Squire)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Scientists analyzed bottle residue from ancient Rome. They found human feces
item.description: Archeologists found evidence that ancient Romans may have used a medical treatment involving perfume... and human feces.
item.content:encoded: Archeologists found evidence that ancient Romans may have used a medical treatment involving perfume... and human feces.
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: Trump's Board of Peace pledges billions of dollars, thousands of troops for Gaza
item.description: President Trump announces 10 billion dollars for rebuilding Gaza at the first meeting of his "Board of Peace"
item.content:encoded: President Trump announces 10 billion dollars for rebuilding Gaza at the first meeting of his "Board of Peace"
item.dc:creator: Michele Kelemen

item.title: Palestinians describe challenges to entering Gaza, despite Trump plan
item.description: Trump's ceasefire plan calls for Palestinians to be able to enter and leave Gaza — but the reality on the ground is challenging
item.content:encoded: Trump's ceasefire plan calls for Palestinians to be able to enter and leave Gaza — but the reality on the ground is challenging
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy

item.title: The owners want to close this Colorado coal plant. The Trump administration says no
item.description: The Trump administration sent emergency orders to keep coal plants running — even when utilities want to shut them down. That's boiled over to a legal battle in Colorado.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration sent emergency orders to keep coal plants running — even when utilities want to shut them down. That's boiled over to a legal battle in Colorado.
item.dc:creator: Sam Brasch

item.title: This week in science: Mental health and chatbots, ultrarunning and intermittent fasting
item.description: NPR's science podcast Short Wave talk about how ultrarunning affects the body, the trend of intermittent fasting and how to protect people's mental health when they talk with chatbots.
item.content:encoded: NPR's science podcast Short Wave talk about how ultrarunning affects the body, the trend of intermittent fasting and how to protect people's mental health when they talk with chatbots.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Carlson

item.title: Former South Korean President Yoon receives life sentence for imposing martial law
item.description: A South Korean court today sentenced former president Yoon Suk Yeol to life in prison for leading an insurrection.
item.content:encoded: A South Korean court today sentenced former president Yoon Suk Yeol to life in prison for leading an insurrection.
item.dc:creator: Haeryun Kang

item.title: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor was arrested. What happens next?
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with Wall Street Journal reporter Max Colchester about the arrest of Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor and the new details that have emerged in the Epstein files.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with Wall Street Journal reporter Max Colchester about the arrest of Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor and the new details that have emerged in the Epstein files.
item.dc:creator: Mia Venkat

item.title: There's outrage in Ukraine as Russian athletes are allowed to compete in Paralympics
item.description: The International Paralympic Committee decided to allow six Russian and four Belarusian athletes to compete under their national flags in Italy. The decision has caused an outcry in Ukraine.
item.content:encoded: The International Paralympic Committee decided to allow six Russian and four Belarusian athletes to compete under their national flags in Italy. The decision has caused an outcry in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Polina Lytvynova

item.title: Former British Prince Andrew arrested because of dealings with Epstein
item.description: Disgraced, stripped of royal titles and now jailed. King Charles' brother Andrew has been arrested on suspicion of misconduct in public office over his ties to Jeffrey Epstein. He denies wrongdoing.
item.content:encoded: Disgraced, stripped of royal titles and now jailed. King Charles' brother Andrew has been arrested on suspicion of misconduct in public office over his ties to Jeffrey Epstein. He denies wrongdoing.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer
